input: Type: Poem, Theme: Love lost, Style: Shakespearean
output:
Upon a time, when hearts did dance in bloom,  
Two souls entwined beneath the silver moon.  
Yet fickle fate, with cruel hand, did sever,  
What once was bliss, now fades, now lost forever.  

Thou wert the sun that lit my darkest day,  
With tender whispers that did gently sway.  
But shadows creep upon our love’s fair light,  
And silence reigns in the stillness of night.  

As autumn leaves, so doth our passion wane,  
In memory’s grasp, I linger midst the pain.  
Oft do I gaze upon the stars above,  
And mourn the fleeting ghost of vanished love.  

Though time may heal, and wounds may close anew,  
Yet still, my heart dost ache for thee, my true.  
In dreams, I seek the warmth of thy embrace,  
But waking finds but sorrow in its place.
